get.description: Get a page of Audiences. (deprecated Public API)

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: ID of the account to which this audience belongs.

parameters.name: limitToId
parameters.description: Limits results to the entity IDs specified; parameter key is repeated, eg. limitToId=1&limitToId=2

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of entities returned in a single page; defaults to 25 entities per page.

parameters.name: pageIndex
parameters.description: Returns the specified page of results given a pageSize; pages are 0-indexed.

200.description: A page of audiences for the supplied account or shared by related retailers.

ApplicationSummaryModelResponse.description: A top-level object that encapsulates a Criteo API response for a single value

ApplicationSummaryModelResource.description: A top-level object that encapsulates a Criteo API response for a single value

traceId.description: The request correlation ID this problem comes from.

traceIdentifier.description: The request correlation ID this problem comes from. (deprecated, use traceId instead)

type.description: The problem's category.

code.description: A machine-readable error code, expressed as a string value.

instance.description: A URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.

title.description: A short human-readable description of the problem type

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem

source.description: A machine-readable structure to reference to the exact location(s) causing the error(s)

ApplicationSummaryModel.description: Used for the /me endpoint. Contains information about the currently authenticated application that we accept to give to our clients

JsonApiPageResponseOfAccount.description: A wrapper class to return a single page of <typeparamref name="T" /> with metadata

JsonApiPageResponseOfRetailer.description: A wrapper class to return a single page of <typeparamref name="T" /> with metadata

PageMetadata.description: Metadata related to the current request

traceId.description: (REQUIRED) The Correlation ID provided by the Gateway. It is also a unique identifier for this particular occurrence of the problem.

type.description: (REQUIRED) The classification of the error.

code.description: (REQUIRED) A machine-readable unique error code, expressed as a string value. The format used must be kabab-case.

instance.description: (REQUIRED) A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.

title.description: (RECOMMENDED) A short, human-readable summary of the problem type.

detail.description: (RECOMMENDED) A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.

source.description: (OPTIONAL) A machine-readable structure to reference to the exact location(s) causing the error(s)

stackTrace.description: (NEVER IN PRODUCTION) A human-readable stacktrace produced by the implementation technology

instance.description: (REQUIRED) A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.

title.description: (RECOMMENDED) A short, human-readable summary of the problem type.

detail.description: (RECOMMENDED) A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.

source.description: (OPTIONAL) A machine-readable structure to reference to the exact location(s) causing the error(s)

Creative202110.description: Metadata and usage info of a preferred deals creative

status.description: An enumeration of the status of the catalog.

currency.description: An ISO4217 representation of the currency products are listed under in this catalog.

rowCount.description:
An indication of the number of products contained in this catalog. Available when
this catalog reaches a success status.

fileSizeBytes.description: The size of this catalog in bytes. Available when this catalog reaches a success status.

md5Checksum.description:
An MD5 checksum of the catalog for use in confirming complete and uncorrupted retrieval.
Available when this catalog reaches a success status.

createdAt.description: The time this catalog was created. Represented as a UTC ISO8601 string.

message.description: An optional information message intended for developer consumption.

ExternalCatalogStatus.description: The status of an asynchronous request to generate a catalog

creativeFormat.description: The kind of creative this template can be used to build.

retailerId.description: The retailer associated to the template

createdAt.description: The time at which the template was created

updatedAt.description: The time at which the template was updated

sections.description: The sections holding various template variables

TextVariableValue.description: A value of a template text variable

ChoiceVariableValue.description: A value of a template choice variable (among different accepted options)

ColorVariableValue.description: A value of a template color variable

assetIds.description: The assets representing the images to be displayed

FilesVariableValue.description: A value of a template file variable (one or several files), like images in a creative

HyperlinkVariableValue.description: A value of a template hyperlink variable

ExternalCatalogRequest.description: A request for a catalog under the specified format. Currently "json-newline" is supported.

Section.description: Section object that hold template variables

type.description: The type of the variable

TemplateVariable.description: A variable in a creative template

maxSelected.description: The maximum number of selectable options

minSelected.description: The minimum number of selectable options

maxChars.description: The maximum amount of characters accepted for the text

maxBytes.description: The maximum amount of bytes per file

minFiles.description: The minimum amount of files requires

maxFile.description: The maximum amount of files required

dependentVariables.description: Template variables unblocked when the option is chosen

ChoiceOption.description: An option given in a choice

startMonth.description: Monthly budget override start month, format "yyyy-MM". If it is null, the StartMonth would be the following month of the last item in the override sequence.

duration.description: The number of MONTHs that the override is active from StartMonth, e.g. "1M". Must end with 'M' or 'm'.

maxMonthlySpend.description: Monthly budget override maximum monthly spend amount.

startDate.description: Daily budget override start date, format "yyyy-MM-dd". If it is null, the StartDate would be the following date of the last item in the override sequence.

duration.description: The number of DAYs that the override is active from StartDate, e.g. "1D". Must end with 'D' or 'd'.

maxDailySpend.description: Daily budget override maximum daily spend amount.
